item.description:
A late change to this event is that Susan will host the movie and not Tom.

One of 10 Russian fantasy movies screening at the MFA in February,
"Rusian and Ludmila" is an epic fantasy/fairy tale from Russian director Alexansandr Ptushko and is considered to be his masterpiece. Based on the poem by Alexander Pushkin, Ludmila is abducted by a sorcerer soon after her wedding to Rusian. The movie depicts events " so captivating and so marvelous that the viewer is sure to be caught up in Ruslan's bravery, his rivals' villainy, and Ludmila's" often feisty resistance to her captor" (MovieRapture). Looks like this might be fun! Here is a complete review:

http://www.cinemastri...

After the film Susan will be holding a Meet-Up sign near the front row and then its off to a local cafe to discuss. Running time is 159 minutes and tickets are $9.00 .
item.name: Great Russian Fantasy at the MFA
